BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The fresh snow and the wind slabs represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls and on wind-loaded slopes large and, in isolated cases, very large avalanches are possible as a consequence of the precipitation. In particular on steep sunny slopes and at the base of rock walls loose snow avalanches are possible. Avalanches can be released, even by a single winter sport participant. Backcountry touring calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
In many places there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack in many places.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be cold over a wide area. Light precipitation.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Gliding snow represents the main danger. Fresh wind slabs at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
More medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches are possible. This applies on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on very steep north and east facing slopes above approximately 2200 m. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas. At elevated altitudes such avalanche prone locations are a little more prevalent. They are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility. Avalanches can reach medium size in isolated cases, especially in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation in the Zillertal Alps and in the High Tauern.

In addition individual mostly small loose snow avalanches are possible. In the event of prolonged bright spells this applies on extremely steep slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
15 to 25 cm of snow will fall on Wednesday. The wind will be moderate.
As a consequence of new snow and wind, mostly small wind slabs will form in particular adjacent to ridgelines. They will be deposited on soft layers on north and east facing slopes.

The snowpack is wet all the way through and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a melt-freeze crust that is barely capable of bearing a load. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2600 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Wind slabs and gliding snow require caution.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Sharp decrease in danger of wet avalanches as the temperature drops. There is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
More mostly small wet avalanches are possible. More gliding avalanches are possible.
Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided. There is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Some snow will fall in some localities. The wind will be moderate to strong at times over a wide area.
The snowpack is wet and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust. The meteorological conditions will bring about a gradual strengthening of the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The new snow and wind slabs represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls and on wind-loaded slopes medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible as a consequence of the precipitation. In particular on steep sunny slopes loose snow avalanches are possible. Avalanches can be released by large loads.
In many places there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The fresh snow as well as the resulting wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be cold over a wide area. Light precipitation.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
More medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches are possible. This applies in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Some snow will fall in some localities. This applies in particular in the north and in the east. The wind will be moderate over a wide area.

The snowpack is wet all the way through and its surface has a crust. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2600 m.
In particular below the tree line only a little snow is now lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Gliding snow requires caution. The avalanche danger will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be cold. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In some localities light snowfall above the tree line. This applies in particular in the regions of the north exposed to the foehn wind as well as along the border with France, along the border with Switzerland.
Since Tuesday small wind slabs formed adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as at high altitude. On Wednesday these will increase in size moderately. They can be released, even by a single winter sport participant, especially on very steep slopes. Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
Loose snow avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they will be mostly small. This applies in particular on extremely steep slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Monday: The weather conditions gave rise to consolidation of the old snowpack in all aspects. Gradual decrease in danger of moist and wet avalanches.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is hard and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust. The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften later than the day before.

Above approximately 2300 m a lot of snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Light snowfall. The sometimes storm force wind will transport the new snow. The fresh snow as well as the resulting wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind slabs have bonded quite well with the old snowpack also on wind-protected shady slopes above approximately 3000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. As a consequence of falling temperatures the snowpack will consolidate during the next few days.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Towards its surface, the snowpack is moist and its surface has a strong crust. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day there will be an increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. In particular adjacent to ridgelines as well as at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Gliding snow requires caution. Sharp decrease in danger of wet avalanches as the temperature drops. Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
More medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches are possible. This applies in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
Individual mostly small wet avalanches are possible.
There is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Some snow will fall in some localities. The wind will be moderate at times over a wide area.
The snowpack is wet and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust. The meteorological conditions will bring about a gradual strengthening of the snowpack.
In particular below the tree line only a little snow is now lying.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind has transported the loosely bonded old snow. There is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The wind was strong to storm force in the regions exposed to the foehn wind. In the last two days mostly small wind slabs formed in particular at high altitude. The wind slabs can be released in all aspects.
As the temperature drops hardly any more moist and wet avalanches are to be expected.

The weather will be clear. The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften later than the day before.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack is favourably layered. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was good. The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust.

At intermediate and high altitudes there is more snow than usual.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Even in relatively flat terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: On steep grassy slopes mostly small gliding avalanches are possible. The activity of wet avalanches will decrease.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack is wet and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust. Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Thursday: The avalanche danger will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of sharply falling temperatures the snowpack will consolidate during the next few days.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Wet avalanches are still to be expected in the second half of the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Even in relatively flat terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: On steep grassy slopes mostly small gliding avalanches are possible. The activity of wet avalanches will decrease.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack is wet and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust. Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Thursday: The avalanche danger will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The conditions are favourable for backcountry touring. There is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The weather will be clear. Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was good. The backcountry touring conditions are mostly favourable.
As the temperature drops hardly any more moist and wet avalanches are to be expected.

In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to favourable bonding of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften later than the day before.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be cold. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Since Wednesday small wind slabs will form in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 2 (moderate), especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas. These can in isolated cases be released, even by a single winter sport participant. This applies in particular on extremely steep slopes especially at intermediate and high altitudes. Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
Individual loose snow avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they will be mostly small. This applies in particular on extreme slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Monday: The weather conditions gave rise to consolidation of the old snowpack in all aspects. Gradual decrease in danger of dry and wet avalanches.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is hard and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust. The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften later than the day before.
Above approximately 2300 m a lot of snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be cold. In some localities light snowfall. The sometimes storm force wind will transport only a little snow.
